sources.title: Other Basemaps:

sources.description: Data from 2018. Free account is required to download data.

sources.title: Agricultural Sales/Area Data:
sources.description: Percent of agricultural sales (map), or percent of acreage harvested (table). Data from 2012. Data table was downloaded from 'Data Download' link. Table columns used in maps are: y12_M017, y12_M020, y12_M022, and y12_M021. See full documentation for full listing of columns used in tables.

sources.title: Crop Area:
sources.description: Data from 2017. Filtered based on appropriate crop types for each category.

sources.title: Farm Value, Ownership, and Irrigation:
sources.description: Average agricultural products per farm (in $1000s), percent farm ownership, and percent of farmland irrigated. Data from 2012. Data table was downloaded from 'Data Download' link. Table columns used in maps are: y12_M017, y12_M020, y12_M022, and y12_M021. See full documentation for full listing of columns used in tables.

sources.title: Prime Farmland:
sources.description: Data from 2016. gSSURGO datasets were downloaded for ID, OR, and WA, and joined with mapunit tables for each state.

sources.title: Grocery Stores:
sources.description: Imported using QuickOSM QGIS plugin in 2017. Tags for import were: shop=supermarket and shop=greengrocer.

sources.title: Grocery Deserts:

sources.title: % SNAP Households:

sources.title: Fast Food Restaurants:
sources.description: Data from various dates. Files downloaded for the following fast food restaurants: Arby's, Burger King, Burgerville, Carl's Jr., Del Taco, Dominos, Dairy Queen, Five Guys, Godfather's, Jack in the Box, Jimmy Johns, KFC, Little Caesars, Long John Silver, McDonalds, Papa John's, Papa Murphy's, Pizza Hut, Popeyes, Quiznos, Sonic, Subway, Taco Bell, Taco Time, Wendy's.

sources.title: Poverty Rate:

sources.title: Food Insecure Population:

sources.title: Livestock Sales Data:

sources.title: All David Rumsey maps licensed under:
Tribal Locations/Information:
sources.description: Notes: Data obtained from this site are sourced to a 1952 book by Reed Swanton, entitled 'The Indian Tribes of North America'. While some of the book's content is certainly outdated, the maps included provided a fairly complete picture of Indigenous homelands. The maps from Swanton's book (and presented on the linked website) were used to digitize the points on this Indigenous History map. Points were placed at the relative center of the territory outlined by Swanton. Point locations are not supposed to be exact, and do not correspond with any actual geographic feature. Rather, their placement correspond to the general location of that tribe prior to Euro-American contact.

sources.title: Biodiversity:
sources.description: Number of species by type per area. Date not provided. The following datasets were merged: bird_total_richness, mammal_total_richness, reptile_total_richness, amphibian_total_richness, fish_total_richness. Data derived from BirdLife International, IUCN, NatureServe, and USGS.

sources.description: The following datasets were downloaded: Global forest cover gain 2000–2012, Year of gross forest cover loss event, Tree canopy cover for year 2000.

sources.title: Tree Species:
sources.description: Species basal area, square feet/acre. RDS-2013-0013_RasterMaps_s10-s350.zip and RDS-2013-0013_RasterMaps_s601-s825.zip were downloaded. Datasets based on FIA species codes.

sources.title: Sagebrush:
sources.description: % Sagebrush datasets were downloaded and combined across 3 regions: Columbia Plateau/Blue Mountains, Wyoming/Montana/Black Hills, and Great Basin.

sources.title: Washington and Idaho Invasive Species Sightings
sources.description: Data current as of July, 2018. Used for all included species.

sources.title: Oregon Invasive Species Sightings
sources.description: Since 2010, Oregon has made a concerted effort to centralize invasive species data from many sources into the Oregon iMapInvasives database. These efforts result in a denser coverage of invasive species observations in Oregon as compared to neighboring states. Lack of data for a specific location does not mean that invasive species are absent from that location.
